quest.name: A Picture Is Worth a Thousand Moms
journal: A foreignly lass in Kugane is looking hither and yon with a noticeably stern countenance.
objectives: Follow hints to search for the locations portrayed in the beautiful bell painting and glorious gate painting.

dialogue.name: PRETTYGIRL02668
dialogue.text: Should you choose to undertake this quest, you will receive no guidance from the journal or the duty list. You will need to read the text carefully and decipher the clues to determine your next course of action.

dialogue.name: PRETTYGIRL02668
dialogue.text: Hey, stranger. Yes, you. The beady-eyed bumpkin with the oafish look on herhis face.

dialogue.name: PRETTYGIRL02668
dialogue.text: Come and have a look at these paintings. I'm trying to find the places portrayed in them.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The young woman shows you two paintings of scenes in Kugane.

dialogue.name: PRETTYGIRL02668
dialogue.text: Any fool with eyes can see they are both somewhere in Kugane. But for all my searching, I've yet to find either place.

dialogue.name: PRETTYGIRL02668
dialogue.text: These paintings are dear to me, but if I'm to ask for your help, I'll have to lend them to you for now. If and when you discover these places, see the paintings back safely to me, or there will be hells to pay.

dialogue.name: PRETTYGIRL02668
dialogue.text: Use hints in the beautiful bell painting and glorious gate painting to find the portrayed locations.

dialogue.name: PRETTYGIRL02668
dialogue.text: So long as you're out and about in Kugane, search for the places in the paintings I lent you. Let me know if you find them. And remember to see the paintings back safely to me.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have found the location portrayed in the beautiful bell painting!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have found the location portrayed in the glorious gate painting!

dialogue.name: PRETTYGIRL02668
dialogue.text: You found both places!? One in the Shiokaze Hostelry, and the other atop the roof of a building?

dialogue.name: PRETTYGIRL02668
dialogue.text: I'm not of an age to enter where ales and wines are poured. And I've no desire to go climbing rooves lest I dirty my clothes. Small wonder I wasn't able to find these places.

dialogue.name: PRETTYGIRL02668
dialogue.text: Right then, let's have those paintings back. They're mementos of my mother, if you must know. She died when I was yet a babe. She painted them by her own hand.

dialogue.name: PRETTYGIRL02668
dialogue.text: I have no memory of my mother. But Father never missed a chance to tell me she was the most beautiful woman in all Hingashi. He claims to have fallen in love with her at first sight when he came to make his living here in Kugane.

dialogue.name: PRETTYGIRL02668
dialogue.text: His family was opposed to their marriage. But they swore themselves to each other all the same, and in the end eloped.

dialogue.name: PRETTYGIRL02668
dialogue.text: When I decided to come to Kugane to visit her grave, I thought to look for these places she saw fit to paint. I hoped they would bring me closer to herâ”€to help me imagine what sort of person she was.

dialogue.name: PRETTYGIRL02668
dialogue.text: I heard she painted them when she was of the same age that I am now. So what the hells was she doing in an alehouse and up clambering around on rooftops?

dialogue.name: PRETTYGIRL02668
dialogue.text: Hmph. I've come to feel like Kugane is a sort of home to me now. Enjoy it, wanderer, as I am. And thank you for helping me know a little more of my mother.

obj.n: By the Grace of Lord Lolorito
